Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery light chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly worn); exterior: painted decoration consisting of unclear motif, perhaps vertical dividing bands with pattern between.
Curator's comments: The motif on the exterior surface of the chalice is unclear. Dividing bands are consistent with the Wild Goat Style, as is the lack of interior decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0136) (phase 2)
